intro: Colubrina vivipara, commonly known as the live-bearing beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered purple berries that persist through winter. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by the development of its distinctive fruit. Colubrina vivipara is a shrub that can grow up to 6 feet tall, with opposite, ovate leaves that have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in partial to full sun and is often found in moist, well-drained soils along stream banks and in woodland edges.
